result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Robert J Mueller was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J Mueller is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Robert J Mueller was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Robert J Mueller was found guilty of Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Counts 1 & 2: Court costs due by payment plan of $50 per month beginning 7/17/15. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

Defendant Robert J Mueller in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State and Defense counsel both ready to proceed. State puts stipulation on the record. 
8:51am Jury panel sworn.
8:52am 20 jurors called to the box.
8:55am Voir dire by the Court
9:06am Voir dire by State
9:32am Voir dire by Defense
9:50am Striking of the jury panel
10:00am 12 jurors selected; court thanks and excuses remaining panel. Jury to try case sworn
10:04am Preliminary instructions by the court
10:15:am Jury excused for recess. Court makes record of jurors struck for cause. Defense requesting sequestration of witnesses. Court instructs as to sequestration
10:20am Recess until 10:35am
10:36am Jury brought in
10:40am Opening statement by State
10:46am Opening statement by Defense
10:51am S.M. sworn and testified
11:28am H.L.D sworn and testified
11:40am T.B. sworn and testified
11:58am J.M. sworn and testified
12:04pm Jury excused for lunch break. 
12:05pm Court in recess until 1:15pm
1:21pm In session outside of the jury's presence.
1:23pm Jury brought in
1:25pm V.F. sworn and testified
1:51pm D.D. sworn and testified
1:55pm J.M. sworn and testified
2:14pm Officer Jason Bergin sworn and testified
2:17pm Officer Steve Footit sworn and testified
2:20pm Officer Matthew Keller sworn and testified
2:22pm Recess
2:38pm In session, jury brought in
2:40pm Officer Kirsten Moertl
2:55pm State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury excused for defense counsel to confer with defendant,.
3:04pm In session. Defendant chooses not to testify. Court gives collequey to defendant regarding his choice. Jury instruction conference held.
3:27pm In session. Defense moves to dismiss. Court denies motion. Parties review proposed jury instructions
3:34pm Jury brought in. Defense rests
3:35pm Jury instructions by the court
3:48pm Closing statement by State
3:56pm Closing statement by Defense
4:09pm Rebuttal statement by State
4:21pm Final instructions by the court. Jury out for deliberation
4:57 pm/cm Case recalled; ADA Wabitsch and Atty Last outside presence of the jury.  Question of the jury.  Counsel excuses defendant's appearance.  
5:02 pm Case off record to allow counsel time to discuss question with defendant; case recalled.
5:04 pm Court in recess 
5:42 pm Case recalled; same appearances.  Jury reaches a verdict of Not Guilty on Count 1; Guilty on Count 2; Guilty on Count 3.  
5:48 pm Jurors discharged.  Court grants judgment of verdict on Cts 2 & 3.  Court grants judgment of acquittal on Ct 1.  Court orders matter adj for sentencing on 6/3 at 8:15 am.

Defendant appeared in person in custody and by Attorney Last. State by Patti Wabitsch. Parties advise ready to proceed to trial on 04/21/2015. State advises may need Miranda Hearing in regards to statement recorded but no recording of the Miranda Rights. Parties agree hearing can be held later in the day. Court orders jury trial to commence at 8:30 on 04/20/2015.

Defendant appears in custody from Ozaukee County Jail with atty Matt Last. Patti Wabitsch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Officer K. Moertl sworn and testified. State rests subject to rebuttal. No defense witness. State requests bind over. Defense moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for trial. State informs. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.

Defendant Robert J Mueller in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance with defendant. Counsel wishes preliminary hearing to be set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Mueller in court, in custody.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for public defender and cannot afford to hire an attorney.  Case to be recalled for Atty Alme-Boaz to evaluate if defendant will qualiy. 
Case recalled:  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rachel Alme-Boaz now appears with defendant stating defendant will qualify. Court finds good cause to extend time limits and adjourns.  Status hearing scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Conditions: absolute sobriety, no contact with victim: S.M. dob 1/13/1998, no contact with anyone under the age of 18

Defendant Robert J Mueller in court with Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Ozaukee County Jail. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Alme-Boaz advises the Court defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation and waives the reading of the complaint.
State requests $50,000 cash bail with conditions. Attorney Alme-Boaz requests signature bond. 
Court orders $25,000 cash bail with conditions and extends time limits.
Matter adjourned to December 3, 2014 at 10:00 a.m. for status on preliminary hearing.
